revised_title: Investigating Lunar-Diurnal Variation of Magnetic Declination at Kew and Hobarton
tldr: This study examines the lunar-diurnal variation of magnetic declination at Kew and Hobarton using photograms from the years 1858 to 1860. The results show a simple and consistent pattern of oscillation, with the magnet being attracted alternately to the east and west of its mean position. The study also highlights differences in the zero-points of the lunar variation at various stations, such as Pekin, the Cape of Good Hope, and St. Helena.
